summary.p: There is nothing to report, as Ambrosius [Blarer] writes [No. 1580]; sends a letter from Augsburg and thanks Bullinger for his successful efforts to improve the benefice for Georg [Wimpfer] in Stein. May Christ protect Bullinger [from the plague]; the church relies on good pastors. Greetings.

div.p: Greetings. I have nothing to write to you as Ambrosius [Blarer] is writing to you. However, I am sending here a letter given to me from Augsburg. I give a thousand thanks for your concern for Georg [Wimpfer], the pastor in Stein, so much so that his stipend has already been increased, largely thanks to your efforts. You have Ambrosius's letters regarding other matters.
May Christ keep you safe for the glory of His church. For what do you think will happen if the church is deprived of its pious ministers?
I wish your entire household well. Farewell. November 5, 1541.
To Lord Heinrich Bullinger, dearest brother in Christ.
